1.text: Slice a slit shaped like an X in the lid of a plastic food storage tub.

2.text: Cut a section of a paper towel roll so it will fit in the tub.

3.text: Put the paper towel section in your plastic tub.

4.text: Pour 1 cup (240 mL) of alcohol-based hand sanitizer over the paper towels.

5.text: Let the paper towels soak in the hand sanitizer for a few hours.

6.text: Slide the cardboard tube out of the middle of the roll.

7.text: Pull the inner end of the paper towel roll through the cut in the lid.

8.text: Rub all surfaces of your hands carefully to disinfect them.

9.text: Don’t make your own hand sanitizer unless you have no alternative.

10.text: Get some 99.8% isopropyl alcohol or 96% ethanol as a base for your sanitizer.

11.text: Combine 2 parts alcohol with 1 part pure aloe vera gel.

12.text: Put your DIY hand sanitizer in a clean plastic container.

13.text: Follow the WHO guidelines to make a large batch of sanitizer.
